stories.text:
I'm looking to build a raspberry pi smart mirror.

On Amazon and AliExpress, there are a bunch of Android-based smart mirrors with pre-built operating systems.

On the other hand, there are a lot of DIY guides where you build the mirror from scratch, including cutting wood and attaching the mirror.

What I'd like is just the smart mirror, pre-built, but as a display only. I want to attach the HDMI cable and control the display using a raspberry pi.

Is there anywhere I can just buy the smart mirror, without operating system, and without having to build it myself?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there a smart mirror with HDMI input?

stories.text:
Used https://www.stathat.com/ for a few projects, and wanted to sign up an account for a new one but it looks like it might not be maintained anymore.

Any good alternatives that matches:

* Extremely easy to use "analytics" * Just want to send a label + a number (often just a +1) and for it to be charted. For example, +1 everything we call a specific API server, and we get a usage call chart * Throwaway or short term data; the usual analytics solutions like Mixpanel aren't so suitable * SaaS
stories.title: Ask HN: Alternatives to StatHat

stories.text:
We're seen in the past geo-fence warrants [1] used by law enforcement to find all active mobile devices within a particular geo-fence area and we've also seen how fitness data has revealed the location of military bases[2].

Could the same techniques be used by the UA government to seek data on Russian ground movements? Is it likely that Apple/Google would comply with such a request?

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geo-fence_warrant [2] https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-42853072
stories.title: Ask HN: Can Ukraine gov ask Google / Apple for geolocation data?
Computer chip industry begins halting deliveries to Russia
Slixmpp 1.8.0 has been released – XMPP library for Python – SleekXMPP
The Authority to Use Nuclear Weapons in Nuclear-Armed States [pdf]
States want to boycott Russian vodka. That won't work

stories.text:
https://youtu.be/yrbv40ENU_o : I have always been a fan of Tom Lehrer and he had penned so many more than the very quotable Periodic Table and New Math.

I was both delighted and saddened when I went back to listen to some more Lehrer this time around..

Also: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=frAEmhqdLFs : Tom Lehrer - We Will All Go Together When We Go

(Realised while listening that in 1967, world pop was only 3 billion!)

https://youtu.be/EJAD2csTQ8A : Who’s Next

Tom Lehrer now on Public Domain and iTunes.

Edited to add: on a diff note.. https://youtu.be/zxFCQplZgKI : The Professor’s Song
stories.title: Tom Lehrer – So Long, Mom (A Song for World War III, 1967)
